intro: Rhexia schiedeana, commonly known as the pinkroot, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to lavender flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Rhexia schiedeana is also notable for its underground tubers, which give it its common name.
